titleStmt.title: Josiah Parker et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10820

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Honl B Magoffin
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky
The undersigned would beg leave to represent to your honor
That at the last term of the Equity and Crimmonal Court for Fulton County that M M. Parker was fined $6000 Sixty Dollars for keeping a tipling house

The Evidence in the case shown that Mr J H Cayer had procured Tavern licens to keep a Tavern at Cayers Station in this county and that he had Employed the said M. M. Parker as clerk and that house used as a Bar Room was detached and not adjoining the house used as a tavern and the Spiritous Liquors was sold with no thought or intentention of transgressing the Law and as this is the first offince we humbly ask you to remit the said fine the said Parker is a youth and is now absent from the state in the army of the Southern Confederacy and if you in your clemency will remit the fine you Will place the undersigned as well as the said M M Parker under obligations to you

W Morris Shff
G. M. Willson C. M. H
Josiah Parker County Judge of Fulton County
A. D. Kingman, Atty
S W McDaniel D. Clerk of the Fulton Circuit & Equity Cr Courts
John T Trent, clk Fulton County Court

Fulton Eq. Ct
$60 } Tipling
M. M Parker
